hints.content:
Recall that the median of a data set is the number that occurs in the middle, when the values are ordered from least to greatest.  

If we line up all of the percent literacy rates in order from least to greatest, we get the following:

$\qquad 55\%, 64\%, 65\%, 84\%, 84\%$

The middle number, or median, of this data set is $65\%$.

The percent literacy rate for a country can be calculated as follows:

$\qquad \text{percent literacy rate} = \dfrac{\text{literate population}}{\text{total population}} \cdot 
100$

In this case, we are given the percent literacy rate of Region B to be $70\%$.  We also know that Region B has a literate population of $18{,}000{,}000$.  

Let $n$ be the number of people by which the population of Region B has increased.  Then, we can express the total population of Region B as $23{,}000{,}000+n$.  

Substituting the above information into the verbal model, we have the following:  

$\qquad 70 = \dfrac{18{,}000{,}000}{23{,}000{,}000+n} \cdot 
100$

We can solve the problem as shown below.

$\qquad \begin{align}70&= \dfrac{18{,}000{,}000}{23{,}000{,}000+n} \cdot 100\\
\\
0.70&=\dfrac{18{,}000{,}000}{23{,}000{,}000+n}&&\text{Divide by }100 \\
\\
16{,}100{,}000+0.70n&=18{,}000{,}000&&\text{Cross multiply}\\
\\
0.70n&=1{,}900{,}000&&\text{Subtract }16{,}100{,}000\\
\\
n&\approx2{,}714{,}286&&\text{Divide by }0.70
\end{align}$

This shows that the population of Region B has increased by about $2{,}700{,}000$ people.

For the third question, we are given that region C would like to increase its literate population by $10\%$.  This means that their goal percent literacy rate is about $65\%$.  We can find $65\%$ of the Region C's total population, or $c$, as follows:

$\qquad 0.65\cdot 4{,}400{,}000=c$

Here we see that $c=2{,}860{,}000$.  

In other words, in $10$ years, the plan is to teach  $2{,}860{,}000-2{,}400{,}000$ or about $460{,}000$ more people in Region C to read.  If this is done at a constant rate, it averages out to about $46{,}000$ people per year.  

(Note:  Because values in the original table were rounded, correct answers could vary by a couple of thousand people in this question.)

Finally, to find the percent literacy rate of the entire country, we must first find the population of the entire country.  

Since the population of the entire country is the sum of the populations of the $5$ regions, we can find this if we first find $X$, the population of Region E.

From the table, we know that $3{,}900{,}000$ is $84\%$ of the total population of Region E.  Changing this into an algebraic equation, we have the following:

$\qquad 0.84X=3{,}900{,}000$

Solving this equation by dividing both sides by $0.84$ gives us:

   $\qquad X \approx4{,}642{,}857$

Adding up all of the regional populations, we find that:

 $\qquad Y\approx77{,}342{,}857$

Since we know that $51{,}600{,}000$ citizens of the country are literate, we can find $Z$, or the percent literacy rate for the entire country as follows:  

 $\qquad\begin{align} \text{percent literacy rate}& = \dfrac{\text{literate population}}{\text{total population}} \cdot 
100\\
\\
&=\dfrac{ 51{,}600{,}000}{77{,}342{,}857}\cdot 100\\
\\
&\approx66.7
\end{align}$

So we see that the percent literacy rate for the entire country is about $67\%$.

The median of the data set is $65\%$.  

The population of Region B increased by about $2{,}700{,}000$ people.  

Region C hopes to gain about $46{,}000$ literate people per year.  

The percent literacy rate for the entire country is approximately $67\%$.

question.content:
The table below contains literacy data from all regions within a country.

Region | Literate population | Total population | Percent literacy rate
---------------------: | ---------: | ---------: | :--------------------
Region A                | $25{,}000{,}000$ | $39{,}000{,}000$ | $64\%$
Region B            | $15{,}000{,}000$ | $23{,}000{,}000$ | $65\%$
Region C                |  $2{,}400{,}000$ |  $4{,}400{,}000$ | $55\%$
Region D              |  $5{,}300{,}000$ |  $6{,}300{,}000$ | $84\%$
Region E  |  $3{,}900{,}000$ |  $X %4{,}559{,}000$ | $84\%$
Entire country | $51{,}600{,}000$ | $Y %77{,}111{,}000$ | $Z %67.2340522\%$


[literacy rate data from]: http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Literacy_rate_world.PNG
[population data from]: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_countries_by_population  

=====

[[☃ group 3]]

[[☃ group 4]]

[[☃ group 2]]

[[☃ group 1]]

options.content:
Which of the following is closest to $Z$, the percent literacy rate of the entire country?  

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: You may have made an error in solving for $X$.  Check your work.
You took the average of the regional percentages, when the percentage literacy rate of the country must be calculated from $51{,}600{,}000$ and $Z$.
This is the most common percentage listed in the table, but the question wants to know the exact percentage of all literate people in the country.

options.content:
Suppose Region C wants to increase its percent literacy rate by $10\%$ over the next ten years and plans to do so by increasing the literate population by a constant amount each year.  Assuming the population of Region C remains constant, which of the following is closest to the number of literate people they hope to gain each year?  

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: We want the percent literacy rate to increase by $10\%$ not the number of literate people in Region C.
Be sure to find the number of additional literate people needed to increase the literacy rate of the region by $10\%$.
This is the number of additional people that will become literate in $10$ years.  What would this average out to *each year*?

options.content:
Which of the following best approximates the current median percent literacy rate for the five regions of the country?  

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: This is the percent literacy rate of the entire country.

options.content:
If Region B now has a literate population of $18{,}000{,}000$ and a percent literacy rate of $70\%$, by about how many people did the population increase?  

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: You may have forgotten to divide this number by $0.70$!
Check your work!  You may have made an error in solving the related equation.
This number represents the new population of region B, but the question asks for the *increase* in population.
You took the average of the percentages, when the percentage must be calculated from $51{,}844{,}850$ and $B$.
